comments.body: Can we avoid the dependency on the maven access? This might make it flaky when the maven access is not stable.
cc @wangyum Could you take a look and address it?

Ideally we would be better to avoid any flaky things, but there's a technical reason to do so - alternative option would be `list of jars` but then the list of jars we provide should be able to load Hive. Moreover, if I understand correctly, Spark needs to pull Hive artifacts from maven/ivy to build, and some suites in spark-sql-hive also try to pull Hive artifacts.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@      // The issue occured from "maven" and list of custom jars, but providing list of custom
      // jars to initialize HiveClient isn't trivial, so just use "maven".
      HIVE_METASTORE_JARS.key -> "maven",
      HIVE_METASTORE_VERSION.key -> null,
      SparkLauncher.SPARK_MASTER -> "local[2]",
